terrible. playing first 2 weeks. everything perfect, maxed out settings game running smooth, fps perfect.
after 2 weeks. logging into game. WTF. fps were dropping down to 5-10, sometimes 2 fps!!! cutscenes,corners,free-kicks, penalties. unplayabe. tried fixing it with different methods from youtube. changing settings in NVIDIA control pannel and ect. nothing helped and I can not believe how developers of this caliber just do not give a shit. how can such a big game running so poorly is beyond me. so many years on the market and still do not know how to optimize a game. requested refund and did not get answer yet. I did not want a refund, because I wanted to fix the game to justify so many hours put into the game and building a really good team. oh well. they have unplayable game so give my money back!!!!!

[h3]I think it's a waste of money, but y'all gonna buy it anyway, because it's the latest Fifa...[/h3]
The game is full of bugs, the fact that EA still can't do anything about kickoff glitch is ridiculous. In my opinion Career Mode is a well made part of the game, but to be honest, 90% of players play Fifa (from last year EAFC) for Ultimate Team.
still great, although I would (again) like to be able to play even on a slower speed.

PROS:
It's FIFA, without the license.

CONS:
It's FIFA, without the license.

The game is crashing often
Anti cheat is creating lot of problems and game closing or not starting

Terrible unfinished product.  Settings menus don't work with controller 90% of the time, it never saves my settings and always sets them back to default, training games glitch out, training arena is terrible, defending is non existent, AI is dumb and refuses to engage the ball in crucial moments, or puts themselves in terrible positions, character traits on players either make them OP or inept, game glitches on start up, doesn't boot up 10% of the time, and always starts in window mode, the amount of possession losses that occur after tackles is absurd, bad bounces and instant counter 1v1s occur way too often and unnecessarily, pause menus glitch out, I just played a game where I paused and the menu was glitched and I couldn't navigate or even resume game; another time I started a game of seasons online and neither my opponent or I had control over our players, we had to just watch the AI play each other, of course I received a loss upon backing out too.  How can you release such an unfinished glitchy product when you've been making it for 15+ years??  Extremely frustrating experience.  I want my money back.
Since December 2023 I can't launch the game anymore and there is no answer from EA at all

Game has peaked. Defense has been unmanageable. You need to have big physique player in order to defend in this game.

I have a 96 pace striker but got outrun by Van Dijk, Saliba and other big physique defender. Like what is the logic? If these players are that fast, put them on 96 pace as well. Literally misleading attributes.

Special cards or icons sometimes are not that good. Whats the point having 90 rated player but is not meta, so they are useless compared to base player 88 rated or so. Again what is the logic behind it.

Uninstalled.
Didn't think 22 could be worse than 21, then 23 worse than 22, now this heaping pile of shit. If you do get it to play with friends, make sure you wait until it is on huuuuuuuge discount.
wastes your money, bad and stupid

i bought it just for the updated career mode (last fifa i had was fifa 17) which is a HUGE improvement there (as expected)

BUT the game kinda sucks, and idk why EA did it 
here are examples that I HATE about it:

1- the UI is a huge downgrade from the last fifa games, it just looks ugly and too basic
2- the AI on this game is GARBAGE, like sometimes they dont even follow the tactics i make for them, and sometimes they do follow them BUT AT A TIME I DIDNT WANT THEM TO DO (AND SOMETIMES ST PLAYERS, INSTEAD OF GOING IN FRONT THEY JUST GO BACK TO CM POSITIONS, WHICH I DIDNT HAVE ANY OF THIS PLANNED IN TACTICS, THEN CB PLAYERS JUST FOR SOME REASON START ATTACKING FOR NO REASON???????????????????)
3- GKs are RNG as hell, doesnt matter how good your GK is, they can get the most insane saves but cant even save a simple one shot sometimes

also people have been saying the game is "unplayable" because its crashing alot, or its "poorly optimized" on their pc, iv never had these issues at all, my pc has a ryzen 5 5600g and an rx 6500 xt (i know its garbage, im very broke) and im getting over 100+ fps at mid graphics and 1080P res, like maybe im blessed with a version that works and has no performance issues, not sure

as much as i want to like it, i cant recommend it if you have an older fifa game (like fifa 20-23), if you have a way older one, then maybe? but still, i hate what they did to it, it feels like a huge downgrade compare to the older fifa games

I bought every FIFA game since 98, i won't be buying FC25, and I uninstalled FC24.

I recommend this game only if you're a FIFA/FC and football fan and you are not poor.

The game is very similar to FIFA23, which was very similar to FIFA22, which was very similar to FIFA21, and so on. So, if you'd just like to have some fun with friends, just play one of the previous versions you already own, so don't buy this game. 

Moreover, this game still has the same annoying controller bug that FIFA23 has, i.e. sometimes you can't move between menu items and you need to use the mouse. I bought an XBox controller on purpose with the intent not to face this issue again, given that it's the only officially supported controller (which is also unacceptable for a controller-based game), but I got very disappointed.

5.5/10

For an average player like me, this game is FAR from enjoyable. For a game that has been around for such a long time, from my childhood to now, the game play is shocking.

Just a few examples listed below....

- Penalties given if you look at someone wrong
- Goalkeepers still dive backwards and miss shots they should easily save.
- 5'0 stick like players, pushing around 6'4 tanks like its nothing
- Players have forcefields and you can't get anywhere near them
- The most beefy and "slow" players travel at the speed of light
- The most ridiculous, unrealistic things happen in games, things far out of your control lose you the game you dominated
- Experienced players smurfing in lower ranks so they can "enjoy" winning
- Opposition leaving a game near the end, making the whole game a waste of time because you don't get rewarded unless you're in the lead.
- Used to feel rewarding getting high rated players in ultimate team, now there's just so many and they are given to you for free.
- There is always a "meta" way to play. Not learning to do so, means you just fucking lose. It's not enjoyable having to play the game a specific way in order to win. 
- The AI is just straight up stupid. They either don't move, or move way too much. They run into one another.

It's my first official FIFA that I've ever bought and played for real.
For a company that made FIFA for the past 10+ years the game is still missing some obvious details and it has some annoying features in it.


EDIT: ( 150 hours ) 11.02.24
I've spent 120 hours on only 1 career ( from league 2 to premier league ) and after I won 2 premier league seasons in a row and bought nice players I've decided to make a second career and to apply what I have learned from my first career. After playing a couple games and then I've decided to load up my old career everything was gone. The save was there but when I loaded it up I've started from the beginning. This is mad. Please FIX your game or hire better programmers to do you job if you can't! ( I found a reddit post that said to save the game manually and not use the auto save & quit option ). Not sure if that's going to help or not but just have that in mind.

EDIT: ( 170+ hours ) 15.02.24
After making a new career players did not want to accept transfer offers, doesn't matter what team it was. Offers from 30M+ etc. they just deny.
I made a second career and it happens again. The game is pure trash.
P.S: I've checked some reddit posts about this issue, some people suggest to put release clause on them and it might fix the issue ( I haven't tested that out ) because it means that I'll have to renew every single contract and sign a new and more expensive deal than the last time because their overall went up and their market value as well.

EDIT: ( 190+ hours ) 17.02.24
After accepting a job offer from a different team mid season I had just one objective and it was to win the championship title. I've made 2 team sheets, so every player can play and be satisfied. I haven't lost a game and 70% of the players on the team were at maximum happiness. But after each game I've won my manager stats was dropping and at the end of the season was on 50%. I've got an message stating that I wasn't able to complete a lot of objectives even though I had only the one for the championship title when I joined the team. SUPER ANNOYING! This also affects you future job offers from bigger teams!

EDIT: ( 200+ hours ) 18.02.24
The game started to crash every time when I try to change the team sheet.
( Found a fix online that helped me ) You'll have to delete that team sheet and create it again.

EDIT: ( 215+ hours ) 20.02.24
Bought Goncalo Inacio as a CB. After accumulating too many yellow cards he was suspended from 1 match. And because I wasn't able to play him after the game he was super upset about it and that I didn't even put him on the field even for a minute. A game later he played the first half and he was tired and I made a change with another CB for the second half. After the game he decided to tell me how unhappy he was and that his damaging his career, so he decided to leave by putting himself on the transfer market. GREAT GAME!

Career Mode:

If you start in League 2 and progress to Premier League you're still going to get paid 15k ( I know that this does not really matter but small details make the game much cooler ).

You have to non-stop monitor your players Sharpness and Fitness and regulate them after each game, otherwise they're going to be tired or they won't be passing the ball well or reacting fast enough. When you have a bigger pause between matches you have to stop 1 or 2 times the calendar progress just so you can regulate their Sharpness and Fitness again because if you put them on Fitness and let them train for 15 days they'll lack of Sharpness eventually. At the beginning this wasn't an issue but now it got supper annoying.

If you sign a kid it will show you what their potential is. But after you move them to the senior squad it will show you only how much they're worth and not what their overall potential is anymore. ( You can bypass that by checking the potential on real players online ).

The negotiations are super basic and their answers are always the same. Also every single time when they say that they want a contract for 2 years you can counter it with an year more. So, if they want a contract for 3 years and you offer them for 4 they'll always accept. The transfer fee is the same.

One more big minus is the fact that there's a press conference before and after each game ( you can skip it ) that boosts your player / team morale. They ask you questions and you answer them. The minus is that they don't actually speak. It's dead silent and you just watch how their mouth is moving. Pretty much it's just like watching TV on mute. You'd expect more for a came that cost 70 euros and it's made from the same company that made the rest of FIFA games. Just get some voice actors and make them record a couple sentences, they're the same anyway.

If you loan a player from another team and you don't let him play a couple matches in a row they'll send you an email that this damages his career and players stats and they might pay the fee and take the player back before the loan period ends. BUT YOU CAN'T send such emails on players that you loaned to other teams. They can put your players on Rotation/Sporadic etc. and you can't do nothing about it. I'd be nice if you could also send such emails.

There should be an option to explain a player a situation. For example I have my main players that play on important matches and I have the reserves that play on less important matches and after each game I get emails from players that haven't played and are angry or unhappy. There should be an option that explains the player that they will play only on less important matches. ( I know when you sign a player if you make his contract Rotation you won't have these issues, but trust me, before you claim to Premier League almost no one will accept Rotation as an option. Everyone wants to be at least Important ).

When you make your career mode you're given an option to select between t-shirt designs etc. I'm pretty sure you'll always find something to your liking BUT ( yeah there's a BUT as usual ), the club logos are made on paint. Absolutely 0 effort is put in them. Super basic, super simple, very ugly compared to the worst real club logo in the game these are twice as bad. Over 10 years into making FIFA and they still haven't learned what should be done with and to the game. ( Let's not forget that there's no sponsors to pick from, so no extra money from advertisement ).

Ultimate Teams:

Haven't played that much and I can't say much about it except:
1: DON'T buy packs.
2. In my opinion earning money is a bid hard ( maybe I haven't learned the right way of gathering money ).
3. The ranking system is sh**. You can play with (50-65) overall players against (80-90+).
4. It's a bit hard to navigate in the menu. ( If you spend some time you'll eventually learn everything, but for a newcomer like me it was a bit hard. )


Kick Offs:
Normal..

P.S: There's a lot more stuff that are minor or important but you get the point.

Playing FIFA since 2001, basically got every game since and I am tired of the nearly non-existent development. The rebranding to "FC24" raised hopes that remain unfulfilled (even after months of patching by the developers). All I can say is "it now basically works without major bugs".

Playing the career mode (either manager or pro) is unbelievably frustrating as it lacks any kind of realism and has nothing to do with the sport.
Why?
- Games commonly end with way to high scores (4:5, 6:3, so on). 
If you don't have 11 half-gods on the pitch you will lose against the computer-team.

- As a manager you can sign massive players for second league clubs, you simply have to to sell a few players for way too much and there you go with the funds to buy anyone you like and they actually join. As if no other team bids for players.
-The only power you have as a "manager" is to buy players and set the formation. No stadium building, infrastructure like training facilities or youth centers, no staff, no sponsoring deals, no detailled training, no detailled tactics etc.
- (youth) players won't develop if they don't play 90% of the games.
 
- As a single pro the rest of your team is absolutely incapable (no matter which club you're playing for), so you are bound to carry the team and can't just act like a normal player.
-The skill tree idea is great but the limitations are strange. For example if your player is taller than 1,90m forget you will ever have a speed above 84 or if you're an offense player your tackling is completely worthless - skilling it just costs so much that all necessary skills would be underdeveloped. Still it's required in the tasks.
- forget to play in any defending position - it's impossible to get good ratings (they are mainly influenced by scoring goals or the final pass. The second final pass already earns you nearly nothing) - further your attacking players will fail you miserably (as your defending team does if you're an attacking player)

-The list could be endless but I guess the point is understood.

EA's strategy semms to be only about selling booster packs to online players, not about actually developing a good game.

Okey after a long time I will finaly post a review of EAFC24 and the FIFA-franchise as a whole. Yes I know that it isn't called FIFA anymore.

This gamefranchise from EA is sadly the only real way to scratch your itch if you are actually looking to play the game, not only manage it (Like FM). The way EA has done it has been insanely painfull to watch. I have played almost every game of FIFA (Now EAFC) since 2010 on console and now on pc and console. It has gotten worse every time, the features they add that are new and cool, they remove as fast as the next version is out. But I get ahead of myself, let me review this game.

They put all of their marbles into FUT and Volta, this is where they milk their whales and scratch the itch of football gamblers. Around 30-40% of their playerbase is supposed to be people that play careermode, a gamemode they have taken a massive dump on, since 2016.

1. The play it self is full of bugs, people glitching out, hitboxes not being in place etc.. I don't know how many times I have rewinded to see that a ball went through a leg or a bodypart because of the hitbox glitching. 

2. The AI has become seemingly worse for every game. The AI reacts to everything as the input is put in on your end, but it seems like your players aren't doing it at the exact second, it has a small delay. Making the opponent seem like they are reading your mind. 

3. The amount of scanned faces is just downright bad. A couple of days ago, started a new career, wanted to play a real manager. It is like less than 30 faces of real managers actually scanned into the game, because instead of putting people they have previously scanned into a folder at the end, they are just removed. I don't care if the small picture of my manager is his real face, when you never see that picture, but you always see the worst version of a fake model for a manager ever created. 

4. Customization on the different platforms... You make a character on Volta or Clubs (the online gamemode vs other playercreated teams), you get access to a huge number of hairstyles, features, tattoos etc.. Those are not accessable on career at all. The jerseys you have on create-a-club is horrible, they say they added sponsors and it is just the Dice logo and an EA logo.. This was something they had on Fifa06, where you chose fake companies that added both a kitsponsors and some challenges to the gameplay to get more money into your save, that feature has still only been in that game.. 

5. Kitsponsors.... For some reason, I don't know if it is licensing or whatever, but if you go online, on some teams, their sponsors disappear. I now have a save with Watford, if I am online, they have no main kitsponsor, if I go offline, they have. 

6. Goalkeepers... Okey, I only have 2 issues with goalkeepers and I will keep it short. They can't save on their nearpost 90% of the time, they just can't, if it is the animations or how they are coded in positioning. I have no clue, doesn't matter if he is 50 rated or 91 rated, can't save it. Problem number 2 with keepers is the way they move, this might be a bug, but sometimes, when you force them out of goal, they seem to pull straight out, not regarding their position at all. So run straight out and the goal being fully open because of their movement. 

7. The gameplay. Okey I will not shit on the gameplay too much, just a tiny bit. For some reason, I still don't know why, this is how EA has treated the gameplay. 2018-2020 - Pace was king. 2021-2022 - Lay the ball into the box, and you will have most chances of scoring goals. In the last games they have added this feature and I still don't know why, powershot. Powershot is seemingly vs the AI the stupidest gameplay mechanic out there, they AI are in your face long before the animation is close to trigger and if they are for some reason not. There are 8 people in your way blocking it, seemingly disregarding every single teammate you have around them, just to block your shot. If you turn handball on in rules, you will have a literal ton of freekicks and penalties, but if you keep it off, they seemingly play handball due to animations and positioning. 

It's probably a lot of stuff I have forgotten to mention but this is what is in my head atm.

Conclusion: Since there are no other good footballgame to play, sadly this is your only option. If you have played this series of games before, you know how bad it has gotten even with its newer shinier finish. I can't recommend it at full price at all. It is not worth it and if you love football, all the small things will annoy you. EA is getting worse and worse for every game they put out, so do not think the next one will be any better.

Why can I be upset about this game: I have around 10k hours in Fifagames in total, most on console. I have followed Fifa since the original Xbox and the PS1, all the way up to PS5, gaming-pc and Xbox One X. I have both played FUT, Clubs, Volta, Be-a-pro and Careermode. Fifa and now EAFC are games I come back to, because I love football and because I see it as a chill pasttime.

Hopefully this is helpful for the ones thinking about buying it. EA will never see this review or think about it, and will probably never change their ways.

Prawn stir-fry

Ingredients:

200g raw, peeled tiger prawns from a sustainable source
1 green Thai chilli, chopped
3 garlic cloves, 1 crushed and 2 finely sliced
1 bunch coriander, leaves and stalks separated
1 tbsp caster sugar
juice 1 lime
3 tbsp fish sauce
2 tbsp groundnut oil
3cm piece ginger, finely sliced, then shredded
8 spring onions, finely sliced
1 red pepper, thinly sliced
85g water chestnuts, sliced
100g beansprouts
1 tbsp soy sauce
egg or rice noodles, to serve
lime wedges, to serve

STEP 1
Put the prawns in a bowl. Put the chilli, garlic, coriander stalks (snip these up using scissors first) and caster sugar in a spice grinder or small food processor and whizz together. Add half of the lime juice and the fish sauce, then pour this over the prawns.

STEP 2
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wok, add the ginger and spring onions and fry for 1 min. Add the red pepper and fry for 1 min, until the pepper starts to soften. Add the water chestnuts and bean sprouts, and toss together until the bean sprouts start to wilt. Add the soy sauce and a really good grind of black pepper, then tip the lot into a serving dish.

STEP 3
Heat the remaining oil in the wok and add the prawns, lifting them out of their juices. Toss for 1-2 mins until they turn pink, add the marinade and swirl the wok quickly, then tip the lot onto the veg. Snip over the coriander leaves and sprinkle on the remaining lime. Serves over noodles with extra lime for squeezing over.

This review covers strictly the online game play portion of the game.

EA FC 24 is, in short, the accumulation of many positives and negatives of the last few years of FIFA. I grew up playing FIFA 08-17, and in this time, I truly believe the game was at its best. Though graphics and physics weren't perfect, they had this element of true-to-skill game-play. From shooting to passing to defense, it all required specifically timed inputs to perform successfully. What I have noticed about new EA Sports games is that their best way to smooth out visible glitches and errors was to switch to an animation system. I call it an animation system because the game seems to follow a loosely pre-planned course that players can, from time to time, increase their likelihood that the animations being shown to them are in their favor. 

As many players have noticed, the so-called "bounce-back system" is a feature that seems to allow certain players (even me, I promise I'm not just crying) to have on the ball advantages and higher rebound potential. Usually in the closing minutes of the game or right after the opposition has scored, the bounce-back system guides one squad to a goal, seemingly to create a closer and more exciting game.

Through all my years of playing sports games and hearing "EA Sports games are scripted" I am finally giving in and agreeing. I have truly begun to believe that the game follows a pre-determined timeline. Maybe not determining a winner before the game starts, but at least guiding the game into a direction it would previously not have gone.

To conclude, I want to say that FC 24 is, in my opinion worse than the last 3 years of FIFA. Pack luck and RGN is no longer a concern of mine as I bought this game knowing I would be disappointed by those things. Content is constantly added that keeps me coming back to the game months after release. I have no where near the amount of hours on FC 24 as I did on FIFA(s) 21-23. Good luck next year EA! :)

Year after year, EA, despite being one of the highest grossing video game company of all-time, you fail to actually deliver a product on release day that is reflective of its price. People are paying a premium for your games every year, and are met with some of the most lacklustre, mundane and boring features every year. Sure, you can blame us for continuing to buy the game, but the truth is, I love football. You love football. And FIFA/EA Sports FC is the only game out there that can scratch that itch. There are no viable competitors. Therefore, through our love for the beautiful game that is football, we keep buying it. And you know that, EA. That is why you refuse to actually do some hard coding in your game and add new features/improve the game.

You are too busy milking all the 12-year old FUTwhales that spend mum and dad's money on your stupid packs, which is all that ultimately matters to you in the end. You do not care that Career Mode has not been proper innovated since the dawn of Jesus Christ, or that Pro Clubs has so much untapped potential. All that matters to you, is FUT, and the whales that keep splashing thousands upon thousands every year, only for all of their players, items, to be obsolete the following iteration of FIFA/EAFC.

I would also like to point out that, despite us paying the same amount, the level of disrespect you have continuously shown us PC players is unforgivable. Not just this year, but every other year. Do not think we have forgot about the absolute disaster of a release that was FIFA 21, FIFA 22 and FIFA 23. If you are lucky enough to even launch the game, you are most likely met with terrible FPS, choppy animations, bugged out player models, and honestly, the list is endless if I wanted it to be. Speaking of lists, I am going to provide one with all of the bugs that I encountered in my first few hours of game-play.

‚Üí Choppy animations, frames drop and becomes an eye-sore to watch.
‚Üí Commentary does not work on launch. There is 0 commentary.
‚Üí Player models, the hair, bugs out when it is rainy and foggy. Becomes pixelated.
‚Üí Can not connect to the internet (whatever this means).
‚Üí Controllers not working properly.
‚Üí Game keeps minimising on PC.
‚Üí The game is not opening and launching for so many players.
‚Üí Can not sack coaches in Career Mode, it just freezes.
‚Üí Objectives not counting.
‚Üí Not getting XP when completing objectives.
‚Üí The game freezes on the EA FC logo.
‚Üí Stuck in half-time animation.
‚Üí Game-play stutter.
‚Üí Overall TERRIBLE performance even on high-end hardware.
‚Üí Anti-cheat error message.
‚Üí Media questions still make 0 sense.
‚Üí Same animations for media interviews and transfers.
‚Üí Same animations for injuries, etc. 0 innovation and creativity here.
‚Üí Menu in FUT will freeze and you have to close the game and launch it again.
‚Üí If you navigate the menu too quickly, it messes up and goes all over your screen.

Again, like mentioned, this list could be as long as you want it to be. The point is, you are incompetent EA, and you are ESPECIALLY incompetent when it comes to creating a proper PC port. But of course, because you know we love football and we simply have no other alternatives, you can keep getting away with this. I am an idiot for playing this game and "enabling it" and I know I am, but that is not going to stop me from speaking out about the disgrace of a company you run.

Also, why on Earth would you remove players walking out onto the pitch and lining up before a game? What went on in your heads over there at EA when you thought, hmm, let us replace this key part of immersion building and realism and replace it with a few stupid cutscenes then immediately throw you into the game where everyone is already on the pitch ready to go. What about Champions League nights, important finals, etc? There is no immersion anymore. You do not get to watch your team walk out, line up, with the anthem roaring in the background, your players lined up and ready to battle it out... it just sends you straight into action. This is SO stupid. As a Career Mode enjoyer (shocking, I know right, cause who still willingly plays this neglected mode?) this totally kills off getting any sort of feeling towards your games, especially big ones. Mind-boggling decision. Begs the question, in typical EA fashion, which iteration of EA FC will you bring back and market as a "brand new, immersive feature"?Year after year, EA, despite being one of the highest grossing video game company of all-time, you fail to actually deliver a product on release day that is reflective of its price. I have played FIFA now FC for almost 10 years. Since FIFA 15 I have played these games and yet I cant bring myself to play this game alot. I just feel that the gameplay is not what gets me to buy the game much anymore. Its the presentation, the decent soundtrack, the ability to play with friends or family, and the new roster. I would much rather play a game in Pro Evolution Soccer 2021 because of its gameplay or even an older FIFA such as FIFA 17/18. This game just doesn't excite me. My issues with the gameplay is that the game has become so e-sport focus that the AI does not do simple intelligent runs, your defenders against AI or players does not step to the ball very much and just continues to give them space inside your own box. Scorelines are routinely very high because there is just no defense. The game itself slows in its improvement more and more each year and for me, the gameplay took a major regression after FIFA 17/18. 

I wish I could enjoy this game, but I just can't realistically do so. Beside the technically issues that I will routinely have with stuttering, frame-rate drops, crashing, and sometimes the game will not open past the loading screen for 3-5 minutes. I am not angry, just grinded down and exhausted. I wish anyone that loves this gameplay the best and I wish you the best in finding joy within this game series. This will likely be the end of the road of me on PC at least. Its time to go explore other games.

After my niece reminded her that she had a drink order for the bar she rolled her eyes and turned abruptly and left to get the drink when she came back I asked could I order something. While she was taking my order the store manager Donna brought over the margarita that was ordered at the same time the appetizers were ordered. I asked while each team member was standing there for a glass of Apple juice in a margarita glass with a side of lime. Kilen and Donna walked a away and after several minutes Kilen returned with a regular mug glass with apple juice not even with lime on the side. When I reminded her that the glass I requested she breath very heavily rolled her eyes and snatched the glass from the table mumbling something derogatory under her breath and stated with as much attitude she could muster " all right" as if I was inconveniencing her with her plans for waiting on our table. So I asked another waitress to send the manager over to our table once she walked away because she was being overtly rude to us the customer. This game is seriously a joke, especially on PC. On top of that, there is clear scripting that goes on in every game mode. For example, you go up by two goals, then all of a sudden your players start moving like they are stuck in quick sand, your opponent (whether it be AI or a real person) will clearly be moving faster than you and they go right down the field and score as you try to click to the closest defender but suddenly the buttons you've been accurately flipping through your players with just dont work the same. You are left unable to switch onto your defender to try to prevent the goal and left to watch in horror as the AI refuses to acknowledge the threat in the box and you 100% get scored on. It is sincerely to the point where you can predict it will happen, and then it does. It specifically happens in intense moments or games (ex. online promotion match, or a cup final in career mode). I still play this game as there are many aspects i enjoy, but unless you can get over the fact that you will be trying to beat another player online while actively watching the game reduce your players abilities in an attempt to sway the game, then you will be miserable. You will watch it happen to people you play against, and it will get to the point where you feel like your wins werent earned and your losses werent deserved. I very much wish i wouldnt have purchased this game.

Edit: I forgot to mention, this is such public knowledge throughout the player base. To the point that people use lower overall players and teams in matches, in an attempt to receive less hindrance. If you are playing with a worse team then your players move smooth as butter and outrun the better players for the other team. Its absolutely wild and infuriating, sincerely one of the scummiest things ive seen a company do in a game.

For context - I have played every single FIFA since FIFA 09 and this is easily the worst football game out of them all.

I will omit all the money-grab moves EA made (only briefly mentioning that the good drops rate in UT is utterly garbage compared to all the previous titles) and focus solely on the gameplay. While with the recent FIFAs some parts of the general experience were screwed (such as match fixing) I never really had any major issues with the gameplay ITSELF. In EAFC24 this is definitely not the case.

First off it is the first time that the refereeing system is completely, and I mean completely, screwed. The use of advantage is terrible - sometimes not triggering at all, sometimes triggering when the advantage is actually being played, sometimes triggering way way too late, after the attacking team has already made an unsuccessful attempt at the goal. I have both suffered and benefited from situations in which:
- a throw-in was dictated despite the ball not leaving the pitch, not even touching the by-line 
- a penalty was awarded without one player touching another
- a red card was given without an actual foul being committed 
and many others. 

Second off, the input is fucked in some way. The controller I use does not matter and they both work perfectly well in other FIFAs. Very often the player will pass/shoot in a completely different direction than you want them to and, seeing from how I am able to regain the ball in many situations, it is not only the case for me but other players as well.

Third off, the AI is ridiculously dumb and I really mean it. For instance the goalkeeper, defending a potential shot from a very acute angle, will simply move away and leave the goal open. Another instance is an AI controlled player that you intend to pass to, upon your input, will start behaving completely erratically - i.e. start backing away  and end up behind an opposition player or just stop in place when you already input a through pass. Lastly, a lot of times the players will just go completely mental (think CB ending up more forward than CAMs despite stay back instructions). It is also very often that the AI controlled players run into each other or the player you are in control of. In general a lot of matches look like they are being played on ice because someone is on the ground at all times

Last off, the online matches are scripted to a degree I have never seen before and the game will laugh at you. I have had matches when the opponent's 85 rated goalie defended like 15/20 shots on target while I've hit the crossbar the other 5 times, my xG is something ridiculous like 9.5 and I still lose 2-1 or 2-0 to an opponent who has taken 2 shots and has an xG of less than 1. Also at times the game will give an enormous boost to the losing side by making the winning side's player act mentally challenged even more than described in the paragraph above.

I've played Fifa since the 90's. This is the worst one yet in my opinion. There's always been metas, there's always been sweats, there's always been toxicity. But the reality is, back in the day, I could beat those people with a silver squad just by being good. Then in later versions of the game, you could use players like 80 Pato against mega squads and still have a chance. Not here. I got the game at the beginning of Jan. I'm already div 2 in ultimate team in 5 weeks, so I'm as good as ever. But getting from div 3 to 2 was a nightmare. Because beyond that point, you're not just playing against ronaldos, messis, mbappes every game. You're playing against TOTY versions, every, game. Unless you're willing to sit doing SBCs 8 hours a day, in the hopes of enough fodder to unlock a decent SBC player, or spending thousands to just pack the players, you don't have a chance. I would say metas have always existed, but this is the most one dimensional game yet. You can predict everything your opponent is doing, because they will just run down the wing and try to cut it back, even 100 times a game, hoping just once it works, and it will, no matter how good you are, because you simply have worse players. 
I've already gotten to the point, 5 weeks in, that i've had enough. I'll keep checking in on the game in the hopes some patches help the gameplay, but at this point its pretty obvious that the poor gameplay is intentional. This game has made EA more money already, than any FIFA before it. And that's for good reason, because people get baited into buying fifa points, because they literally cannot compete in any capacity without it, unless you have seriously good pack luck and pack a decent player out of your weekly rewards, however, good luck, because pack weight is woeful. Yes you can get plenty of 86+ gold players nowadays, but they're all fodder price, you can't make coins by selling these players like you used to be able to, because unless it's a promo card, it's worthless. Well, that's if you can sell them anyway, because 99% of things you unlock will be untradeable. Road to glory is impossible on this game, unless you're happy in div 6.

Only playing single player manager career and it runs OK. But from my experience i'd recommend keeping the visual settings at 'Auto', as this seems to be the only setting that runs at a stable frame-rate. 

Had it set to high at one point and the frame dips when corners were being taken were outrageous. Only playing it capped at a modest 60fps and it was dipping down to mid 10s/20s for any set piece at eye-level with the lower stands. Also any cut scenes were lagging and skipping horrendously. 

It's clearly not the best optimisation but if you're in the market to take Mansfield Town to win the treble three seasons in a row this shouldn't let you down. As for Ultimate Team/ Online, not a clue. Also don't buy it at full price, wait till its on sale. Doesn't really justify it's price tag with the performance issues at the moment, plus never really understood why EA charge 60 quid a year for the same game anyway.

This game is beyond terrible. Every year EA slightly turns this into a disaster. The price is definitely unworthy. Very inaccurate football simulation, and gets worse by each release. Has nothing to do with the actual sport. Basically, the win formula in UT, is purchasing bunch of fast players (meaning high pace values), instructing them to stay forward and get in behind the opponent defence line and send "through balls" nonstop until you score enough. Everyone tries to utilize same strategy and it is truly tedious and annoying. The dribbling and ball control abilities of offensive players is a joke. Anyone who actually watched a football match understands there is no way one player can keep a ball for so long in his feet. Ball is almost glued to the feet of offensive players and it is almost impossible to tackle or intercept to win a ball. So called "Pro gamers" memorize certain button combinations and utilize those skills to scatter opponents, and there is no way to beat them except for wasting tremendous amount of time on mastering those "skills". The amount of bugs and errors in this game is shambolic. EA absolutely does not care about the improvement of the gameplay whatsoever. Avoid this game at all costs. It is very sad that this game is considered as a best football simulation out there.

I was really excited to play this game when I first got, but I have discovered some serious bugs which really ruin my experience of the game. I play with a playstation controller and sometimes, perhaps every two or three minutes, the game will simply stop registering my inputs. For example I'm dribbling the ball and press the pass button, but instead the player just keeps running. For around 10 seconds at a time I'm unable to shoot, pass or really do anything other than just run. Sometimes its worse with it not allowing me to switch players, run, or even move at all. I've tried multiple controllers and it happens to all of them as well as my keyboard. The game would be pretty good if it wasn't so buggy.

Only reason I'm giving this game a positive review is because I personally had a lot of fun in it. As someone who plays mostly career mode and hasn't owned any of the other recent FIFA games, I'd be lying if I said that I didn't enjoy it. That being said, it does have it's issues, obviously. I have not played FIFA 23 much, but from everything I have seen and heard previously, it's pretty much just a retexture of the previous one. 
Was not the biggest fan of Ultimate Team past 2017, so I can't say if it's any better or worse in that regard but the career mode is alright, I'd say. I like some of the new mechanics that were implemented, but they're nothing massive by any means. At it's core it's just classic career mode, with a few new options. The cutscenes haven't changed at all, the way transfers work is mostly the same and certain aspects are completely broken. The broken and OP things aren't too much of an issue in my opinion, seeing as you don't encounter these things 90% of the time, but if they bother you that much, you can always download a few realism and bug-fix mods, if you have the time.
With all that being said, I can recommend the game but only if it's on sale, and you don't already own FIFA 23.

EA FC 24. On the surface, a normal soccer game that you can have fun in, until you start to dig deeper. The greed that is shown through this game by Electronic Arts, and the amount of times they just straight up ignore the community is astonishing. Each year they advertise the game as improved yet when you actually play it, it feels like it degraded compared to last year. Career mode got "improved" because of which the fun that came with it is mostly gone. Ultimate Team has constant bugs, overpowered players that you can make with said bugs, pack weight manipulation, content that often ends up bugged or just not thought through just as it was with a pick that you had around 30% chance of getting TOTY Messi in, and the list goes on. If you think about buying this game, don't do it. EA doesn't think of you as a player but rather as a money printing machine. This game will bring you more nerves than you think you could have and yet it will still manipulate you into playing it. This year was my last time playing any FIFA/FC game, and as much as ut pains me, the way EA is handling the game, and most likely future games will only make it worse and take out all the fun you could have with it in recent years.

The game is filled with bugs, poor gameplay (where everyone is just playing the same formation and doing cutbacks all game long) and constant errors by EA.
Last error completely killed Ultimate Team for the majority of people. Specifically, they have released an SBC where a lot of people ended up getting TOTY Messi for practically doing NOTHING but being the first ones to complete the SBC before it was removed. 
This is a huge disappointment to those who grind every single objective, every single game mode to get a good card into their team. Now, even in lower divisions, you have to face Messi, who is debatably one of the best cards atm.
So, huge thumbs down for the game and the company in charge; do not buy the game.

I‚Äôll start this off by saying fc 24 is bad and not worth your money.

Ever since I bought this game I‚Äôve been so confused as to the way my players perform.  I‚Äôll watch other streamers, and albeit they have a hard time with the gameplay too, even their players seemed to move more fluidly than mine.  It was really making no sense, until I finally came and looked at the pc reviews I realized that the pc port is absolutely garbage. 

If you can actually get the game to launch properly, having to jump through a series of hurdles most times, you are faced with a horrible experience.  The gameplay on console is bad, it‚Äôs even worse on pc.  Playing online is seriously the most infuriating thing in my life.  I can barely get through a single rivals game without almost punching a hole in my drywall.  My players are constantly either skating on ice or moving through water.  Every touch is too heavy or just simply gets stuck at your feet.  Moving around on pc in this game feels absolutely atrocious.  

Skill moves simply won‚Äôt register, I don‚Äôt know how many times I‚Äôve had to input the same skill move 3 times in a row just for my player to somehow fuck it up, a simple ball roll will fail to register 95% of the time.  

I don‚Äôt know how they did it, but somehow player switching is broken.  You will constantly switch to a player that is far removed from the play, making you move that player thinking it will switch to the cdm in front of the player with the ball.  This routinely causes you to move your players out of position leaving easy scoring opportunities.  You used to be able to counter this by directly switching with left stick but somehow they made this impossible. Want to switch from your cb to your cdm with a simple flick to the right? You are now controlling your left mid.  I don‚Äôt know how they did it, but somehow they made this impossible to navigate. 

Your keepers will not work.  Half the time they make a world class save, the other half the ball phases through their hands.  This game is so full of shitty, inconsistent garbage gameplay that not even ghandi could make it through a rivals match without wanting to kill someone. 

There are a whole host of other things I could get into, like the predatory gambling casino for minors lightly facaded as packs, but I‚Äôll leave it there.

The physics are sometimes messed up, but it's still a pretty fun game, very similar to fifa 23, but with a bit slower gameplay and the addition of playstyles. Playstyles are a core mechanic of the game which separates it from the other fifa iterations and to me it is a very fun twist on the standard fifa gameplay formula. Simply put, every player now has their specialty on the pitch, sometimes being kind of ridiculous, other times maybe being a bit unnoticeable. Ultimate team is where the game really shines and the pay-to-win aspect isnt thaaat bad.

Great graphics and presentation. They have most of the teams licences (brazil and roma are missing). The PC control mappings sometimes bug out, but you can get around that. All in all its a good game, its just that to get to the fun part of the game, you need to go through all of EAs bullshit, which include the poor optimization, the pay-to-win packs and the very random and sometimes almost unexplainable bugs. Regardless, I would still recommend it, as it is the best football game out there unfortunately and it sometimes has its bright moments.

This is the first FIFA game I've ever played, and it will also be my last. The entire focus of this game revolves around Squad Building Challenges (SBCs) and completing objectives; progressing is nearly impossible without engaging in these features. If you're considering buying the game, I strongly advise against it at this point. It's already too late, as most players have acquired strong cards, making it difficult for newcomers to compete. Additionally, the game mechanics are complex, requiring a significant amount of time to learn. If you are new to FIFA, I recommend avoiding the purchase as it can be challenging to catch up and enjoy the experience.

EA have dropped the FIFA moniker after losing the naming rights and are now presenting their premier football franchise with a fresh look. Here are the pros and cons, cons first:

CONS
Possibly the worst gameplay of the FIFA franchise. Players move behind their markers consistently leading to needlessly lost possession, passes often lead to nothing, it takes an absurd amount of time to even get your FUT squad even to 86 unless you buy coins or points and any other modes besides FUT and Career Mode are akin to huffing pure carbon monoxide.

PROS
Menus look really nice, bugs aside. The redesign feels very fresh and clean, and the menus are newly optimised for lower end hardware in comparison to FIFA 23. Mods, as usual, heavily carry this game just like any other FIFA franchise game on PC. FIFER, RODE, WZRD and the eSIM projects are all worth looking into this year just like any other year and they all deliver well. The game has FAR better performance than 23 and even 22, leading to being able to run this on anything from lower mid end to the upper echelons of PC builds. Career mode feels roughly the same as 23, but that's not to discredit the mode. It still delivers (as long as you use mods) just like any other variant of it and there's lots of room for creativity. I haven't played Pro Clubs as of yet but I assume it offers much of the same as it always has, same goes for VOLTA this year.

THE VERDICT
Use the Anadius Denuvo workaround to play this game until you're 100% sure you want it, the gameplay is different enough from 23 for this to be kind of a neccessity. It runs far better than 23 but it still can have performance issues on very low end hardware. And of course, modding is the way to go as always.

I'd rather flush my money down the toilet than subject myself to the torturous experience of this so-called game. It's like the developers took a crash course in game design from a malfunctioning toaster.

I decided to give FC24 a chance after a two-year break from their games, thinking maybe they've improved. Big mistake. This game has done wonders for my stress levels ‚Äì by which I mean it's elevated them to new heights. I should have stuck to my peaceful pastime of betting on turtle races; at least there, the unpredictability is intentional.

It's evident that EA has assembled a dream team of interns who must have learned game development through interpretive dance. I'm convinced they're using ChatGPT to code the entire mess. The gameplay is so scripted that I half-expect the players to break into a synchronized dance routine at any moment. I wont even lie when it comes to scoring goals against my opponent as I sometimes pity him and feel his distress from the shear cancer of this game.

And let's talk about the impeccable physics ‚Äì or lack thereof. Suddenly, players move like they're carrying the weight of the world on their shoulders. It's like they're auditioning for a slow-motion ballet instead of playing a football game. Passing, tackles, and rebounds? Ah, who needs logical game mechanics when you can have chaos that feels completely AI-controlled?

In conclusion, FC24 is a masterpiece if you consider "masterpiece" to be a synonym for disaster. Save your money, buy a bag of popcorn, and watch turtle races instead ‚Äì at least you'll get more excitement and a better return on your investment. There is no reason for you to wipe some years off of your life just to pursue the "perfect UT team" as if its going to make your life any better.

If you have FIFA 22/23 do not buy...

Same as ever. Minor, incremental and barely noticeable changes made to last year's game so that they can sell it again at AAA prices. This is the formula for these sports titles and EA FC is no different. On the plus side, the name change is just cosmetic... for all intents and purposes, this is the FIFA of old.

Judged solely on its merits, its not a bad game, UI is a bit different but plays like any old FIFA. Tons of fun to be had playing with friends and the cross-play feature is welcome in that respect. 

Ultimately, however, this game should not be published annually, rather every few years with annual updates and player packs. The "improvements" year on year do not justify EA selling it as a brand new game. Only worth buying if the last FIFA you played was 5+ years ago.

Honestly this game is waste of money. I am a single player who likes to play career mode, therefore I will only comment on single player element of this game. 

As you play this game in career mode, you face an obstacle that inhibits you from enjoying this game, which is difficulty. The problem is that this game does not know how to properly balance the game play. When placed on easy difficulty, all the AI opponents do not play defense and let you run through them like they are bystander. The bigger problem rises when you actually want challenge. When you go for higher difficulty, all of sudden you face dumbed down teammates, not sophisticated opponents. To watch 3 defenders practicing social distancing on 1 opponent, refusing to contain or tackle him is plain brain cancer experience that you get to witness the entirety of the game. I honestly do not understand how does EA Sports keep releasing basically same game over and over every year without putting in actual improvement to their AI opponents and teammates.

My advise to anyone who might be considering buy this game is do not waste your money on glorified 3D soccer animator. I promise you, only difference between previous Fifa game and this is updated roster.

As an avid fan of the FIFA series, I can't help but express my profound disappointment with FIFA 24, a game that seems to revel in mediocrity and an astonishing lack of innovation. It's disheartening to see a franchise that once set the standard for football simulation now mired in a quagmire of stagnation.

One of the most glaring issues with FIFA 24 is the blatant lack of innovation in gameplay. It's as if the developers took a time machine back to the last decade and decided that the formula from ten years ago was still cutting-edge. The game mechanics feel tired and overused, with no real attempt to introduce fresh ideas that could breathe new life into the series. It's essentially the same game on repeat, a disheartening reality for those who were hoping for progress and excitement.

The bugs and glitches in FIFA 24 are not mere hiccups; they're game-breaking nuisances that make it clear the developers prioritized a rushed release over a polished gaming experience. From players getting stuck in animation loops to bizarre physics defying the laws of football, it's as if the QA team took an extended vacation. These issues not only disrupt the flow of the game but also highlight a lack of commitment to quality control.

What's most perplexing is the disregard for fan feedback. Over the past decade, there have been countless suggestions and requests for improvements, ranging from refined career modes to enhanced AI intelligence. However, it seems as if these pleas have fallen on deaf ears, and the developers are content to ignore the loyal community that has supported the franchise for so long.

In conclusion, FIFA 24 is a prime example of a once-revered series that has lost its way. With minimal innovation, a plethora of bugs, and a refusal to listen to the voice of its community, it's difficult to recommend this game to anyone looking for a genuinely engaging football simulation experience. Save your money and stick with an older version or explore other football titles that prioritize progress and player satisfaction over a quick cash grab.

The game mostly remains a repeat of Fifa 23, carrying over many of the same features masked in newly designed user menus (slightly more confusing to navigate). The gameplay (online multiplayer, Ultimate Team) is fast paced, often times reaching scorelines of 5+ goals, and can seem inconsistent at times in regards to the matchups with other players. The addition of in-game playstyles also adds to this inconsistency, where a specialist trait can guarantee a free kick, long power shot, or other type of goal. On a notable aspect, animations are fluid and the motion capture has been done very nicely in the new Hypermotion V segment. While some will enjoy the smooth movement, seasoned players may find left stick control lacking without the use of the close dribble playstyle.

Overall, its a football video game which most will be familiar with over other offerings, and even if "Fifa" isn't in the title anymore, it remains a chill (but bug filled) title that you can grind for hours, or pickup once in a while.

TLDR; Build team of players, run around with ball, put ball in net, repeat.

As a loyal fifa/ea sports fan for the past few year, I must confess that this is the worst fifa/ea sports game to date. I spent 300+ pln for this game and it is not worth it. There are constantly new bugs that usually arent fixed for a month. For example there was a bug where in ultimate team it would at all times show you that you had 2 objectives to claim. This bug wasn't fixed for a few months, and it wasn't just me since my friends had similar experiences. The micro transactions are getting out of hand as last year buying packs could only get you so far, but right now it seems like there is always 600k or 500k packs which give you like 100 players. While this wouldn't be unusual later in the game, packs like these have existed for a few months, even when the game was new. I went into this game excited for what they would add, but after realising it was a copy and paste of fifa 23 with women and a different ui that also had more glitches and microtransactions, I will buy ea fc 25. I have always love fifa/ea fc, but with how absoultley shite this game is, it might be the end of a beautiful era, an era where Fifa/ea fc dominated the gaming industry.

Btw sorry about about my grammar, but it is late at night for me and my brain isnt functioning correctly rn.

Played a few games and went through the training portion of the game. This is a view from a short playtime though a bit too long to get a refund, my mistake there.

While I enjoy football games and previous iterations of FIFA this version is very similar to all other versions played with very little in the ways of improvement. If you have an earlier FIFA game, might as well continue unless you're after the most recent transfers and such.

Sadly there are a fair few bugs on the PC/Steam version:
1. Laggy/Jumpy cutscenes/celebrations
2. Training commands keep repeating during practice sessions when they have told you several times before.
3. Running animations in character creation look terrible with skeleton issues.
4. Mouse and controller constantly fight each other on menus. Even when you move the mouse off screen when you finish a game or open a menu it resets back to the centre of the screen to begin a fight again.
5. Controller inputs on the bumpers and triggers tend to be hit an miss as to whether they get recognised.

Edit:
More bugs found after a longer play and one that makes Ultimate team completely unplayable. Unsure what causes it but whenever I skip the cutscene in ultimate team the pre-game scenes remain on pitch and players run around doing the T pose and unable to touch the ball.

Another year another...wait a minute! Seems like FIFA and EA Sports are ending their partnership and that comes with a name change.. but what else?
Oh well they lose the FIFA brand but not the licensing portfolio which means the game will continue to be same  ,,FIFA'' we play every year which is a good thing this time.

There's a variety of game modes we're familiar already with,personally i miss the Alex Hunter journey or something similar oh well i guess all good things comes to an end.

Playstyles makes the difference this year between players, now it spotlight stars even more and they stand out from the rest. It's a new mechanic that is implemented for those with special talent allowing them to shine and make the difference. 

Theres subtle additions to gameplay, some changes in Career mode ,Volta football but at his core the game remain the same as in previous Fifa titles.
Ultimate team of course got improvements because it's the game mode that brings the money from microtransactions. But you don't have to spend a dime ,you can earn good players from squad building or earn coins from challenges or matches which you can use to buy what you want from transfer market.

I'm glad they kept Volta football,it's a fun street football mode.

On a positive note,even with their departure from FIFA brand they didn't lose content .
And now about rivalry. Looking at you Konami,it's true your game is free but at what cost?

Hate to say it but even if it's the same game from last years ,it remains the best football game on the market.

Pros:
-PlayStyles
-Hypermotion
-Improved Career mode,Ultimate team
-Volta Football is fun

Cons:
-we won't get innovation and large improvements until next-gen consoles arrive

So i played some Fifa games in the past like the original Fifa Street, 09, 12, 13 and 14. So compared to those i think gameplay (when it's good) is better. But, there are many faults with this game. Random connection losses not due to my internet, UT is crashing most of the time when trying to buy players in the club or SBC Club section, menus being slow and way slower than normal at times, the gameplay is very inconsistent a lot of the time with players being slow at shooting or passing the ball and some passes not hitting at all (This is a reoccurring issue from the previous installments from what I've heard 20, 21, 22 and 23). If you can get over those issues it can be a great game, but most of the time it kinda sucks the joy out of it. Would i recommend this game? Maybe, if you're trying to play the game competitively while taking it very seriously, i wouldn't recommend it, that will just end up in you breaking your equipment which is not a very good economical decision considering the game is already 70‚Ç¨ (which is kinda overpriced for what you get). For casuals? I would say you can have some joy in this game, but it has definitely lost it's shine over the years and has become more and more pay to win since last i played which was Fifa 14. I hope they redo the spaghetti code this game runs on for the coming installments in the series, if not i wouldn't say it's worth copping unless you have a pack opening addiction.

(TURN BACK NOW!!!!)If you are like me sitting there deciding whether to get this game on Console or PC just turn back to console right now, EA don't get a shit about PC they never will, the game is horrendously optimised i mean its some of the worse I've seen, I have a strong PC(7900 xtx 5800 3xd) and i have to play with texture settings on medium or otherwise you'd see game ruining stutters , If you're thinking "i'll get mods for it" think again, you have to install mods every new title update, mod support isnt what it used to be for this game so it takes a couple of weeks or months for the mods to catch up to the title update, by then a new title update has probably released. Title updates always put you at risk of getting your files deleted for career mode so have fun starting a new save every month or so. At this point there really isnt any reason why you should get this game on PC turn back to PS5 or Xbox save yourself the money and stress. First off, I'm a FUT player, so I think I can call myself a "non-casual" player unlike the people that only play seasons or career mode, which I would consider "casual." I play rivals every week and weekend league every weekend for the first couple months after release.

There are things that I absolutely love about this game. When gameplay is good, it's really fun. But, EA hasn't optimized this game for PC and it can be very jittery and unresponsive, which seems like it's occurring more and more. FYI, I play this on a ~$2000 custom built PC, so it should run VERY well and it just doesn't. 

Ping isn't respective of what actually happens in game. When you're loading in, it'll tell you that you have 20 ms ping and then once you get into the game your ping will spike to 50+. 

I love soccer (Liverpool fan), and I log onto this game everyday just to see what SBCs there are and to play a couple games. However, I find myself not wanting to play, or just logging on and logging back off. I would love a soccer game that just focuses on good gameplay, and EA has missed that this year.

Awful, a disgrace, an attempt of what Fifa once mean.

The game has the exact bugs from Fifa 23 and even more.

The UT has 4 game modes (Division Rivals/Squad Battles/Fut Champions/FutDraft) and every game mode feels different, the players move differently, the players seem to have different stats, u have to learn 4 different games to play it.

Most of the players have fake stats that doesn't apply in game, for example, every CB with 80+ pace can easily catch a striker with 99 pace.

Every shot from outside the big area is goal, or at least 95% of the shots.

The women are overpowered, most of them have stats better then the big players that we now nowadays.

The objectives are always bugged, saying that u have completed some, and then u go redeem it still stays u have to redeem.

A lot of times the images in the player cards are bugged, and appears the card without the player, or with 2 players.

Once icons were like an achievement, something that make us feel good and powerful because it was hard to get them, now there's like 20+ SBCs of icons, most of them easy to complete and they give tons of them also in the season pass so icons now are like normal players.

There's one specific graphics definition (the one specific to the hair) that causes you to lose a lot of fps in cut scenes, like you are playing in 144+ fps and drop to 20.

The gameplay is a disgrace, with bugs every match and the AI is just terrible and stupid most of the times and make it so that you suffer goals in the most ridiculous possible way.

Basically, i play Fifa since Fifa 07, and i saw the game having his ups and downs but nothing too serious, this one is the perfect example of a bad game where u have one previous with problems and instead of fix the problems to launch a new game, u launch it with even MORE problems.

For more information watch this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ZG9cxPE8aQ

Even if I put graphical settings to the absolute minimum, the problem still doesn't go away.  I stopped playing for 2 months hoping EA would put some optimisation patches out, but anyone who has any experience with this terrible company knows that's extremely wishful thinking.

It could be a great game if EA wanted it to be.

The introduction of playstyles and evolutions are fantastic.  The introduction of women's players into FUT is wonderful.

But the online play modes are currently awful. The midfield is horribly congested and the AI autopress is hilariously overpowered.  If you try and play tiki taka football in a way that has been possible for the last 10 or so FIFA games, this time you'll struggle to put more than two passes together before the ball is intercepted by an opposition attacker with low defensive stats.

There was a period following a patch in December where the gameplay was much better but things seem to have regressed badly by early January.  This has been deflating because it suggests the autopressing gameplay is an intentional design decision by EA - rather than a clumsy attempt to counter negative park the bus online play.  If this is the case, I think this might be the last FIFA/FC game I play in a while.

This game is completely rotten, do not buy it. 

The only reason I have it is to play Pro Clubs with my friends. I had  been a fan of Ultimate Team for years, but it has gotten so broken and exploity that if I was an EA game developer, I'd tell people I don't have a job, because I'd be that ashamed to be anywhere near this with a ten foot pole.

Everyone runs the same high press and uses the RB button to force the AI players on their team to rush you for tackles. It is regular to see an opponent's CDM in champs end the game with 11 intercepts and no tackles; those intercepts are courtesy of double tap RB, where a player can make their team cut off the nearest passes for the opponent - this has not been fixed in patches this year. The reality is that no one controls their own players to make tackles anymore, they just get the AI to do it with double tap RB, good old fashioned RB, or the AI doing offball tackles because of the 71 team depth setting. 

Lets not even touch the fact that they release different card promo's every week for the same players that everyone uses, and they have tons of 'special' packs in the store to get better luck packing certain types of cards (depending on current promo's), which is a blatant cash grab at your wallet. 

The scripting is no longer a myth - some of the mistakes your players will make if your leading past the 60th min mark are uncontrollable, and this built into the game by EA so that games are 'exciting' and 'competitive'. 

I cant remember the last time I actually enjoyed playing ultimate team and I gave it up in the new year. Now that EA have successfully moved away from Fifa and can keep all profits for themselves, they will only continue to get more and more blatant with this. Please do not go near Ultimate Team, especially if your a teenager.

I have a huge love hate relationship with this game and series overall but it really comes down to the fact that there isn't a better alternative and honestly, there never will be. The gameplay for me at least has always been the most fluid and enjoyable out of any football game.

Career mode has its minor improvements as per usual, dead game modes like VOLTA and Clubs still exist, I only say dead because EA don't listen to the community when it comes to improving them.

Crossplay is enabled across the board with all game modes, unfortunately crossplay isn't available for the Ultimate Team market meaning we still have a pretty bad market in comparison to console.

Ultimate Team is really good, obviously pay to win but with enough grinding you can build a team of your dream players pretty easily depending on how much you play.

Honestly my one issue with this game is the fact that they made Ultimate Team have both men's and women's team, its not the fact that they are women or anything like that for me, I actually enjoy the women's sport, even if I have watched far less of it. It's more that for me, I have much more sentimental value when it comes to men's players and getting an ICON pop up only for it to be someone I have literally NEVER heard of, really sucks. In my opinion they should be put into two different game modes based on this alone but then you could argue that you are setting that mode up for failure given the fact the women's version of the sport is far more unpopular.

Put it this way, if I pack 93 Rated Ronaldinho I am waking up my entire household at 3AM, if I pack 93 Rated Mia Hamm, I'm shrugging it off because there is absolutely NO sentimental value for me.

Overall though, its an EA Sports game, you know what you are getting into, huge focus on the Ultimate Team game mode, pay to win aspects or endless grinding and a usually stable, enjoyable arcade experience.

For reference, I am running this game on a high end gaming PC.
I have played almost every FIFA since FIFA 96, and it's no secret that EA do very little to change the games each year, but this year's edition really takes the price for low effort from EA. It really does feel like this is a BETA edition and we are still waiting for EA to release the finished game. EA football fans must have becomes accustomed to half finished games, otherwise there would have been an uproar. CDPR received so much negative press for their disastrous Cyberpunk 2077 release, a game they then spent a long time fixing to give the fans what they initially promised. Trust me when I say, this launch is much worse than CDPR's, and it has already been four months and no sign of EA trying to fix anything. I also find it an insult to the fans that a game released in 2023 is adapted to run on a severely outdated PS4, it shows how little effort EA have put into making it the best game possible, they just want to make money from it. 
They have as in previous versions, taken the predecessor (FIFA 23) and edited it, which should have been fine as FIFA 23 is a decent game, but the decisions they have made along the way are terrible. Everything seems like it's geared towards the features where they can make money from microtransactions, and the features that made the game so popular over the years have been neglected. Manager career mode is plagued with bugs, features that don't work, other features that instantly forces CTDs. Player career mode is really lackluster as your CPU controlled team mates act the same as players you don't control while you play the whole team, meaning the defenders sort of just run along with the attackers but don't actually try to take the ball away from them. There is no possible way either of these features passed any sort of testing phase in the EA developing office.
There are a ton of other issues as well that shouldn't have passed any testing, the pitch weather and lighting can completely change as the ball goes out for a throw-in or goal kick. Giant blocky shadows appear and disappear during game play, I've had random players freeze in place while the game still moves on and the other 21 players move just fine.
If all the issues and unfinished game play wasn't enough, there are also really odd additions. The lighting in the player creation screen now comes from the side rather than head on, so you can only clearly see half the player's face, another feature that shouldn't have passed any testing. As usual, the game is designed to simulate a TV broadcast, so why did they have the referees hand out cards in first person? You go from playing in third person to suddenly see the view from the referee's eyes. why? The game is full of these odd decisions. 
I highly recommend you stick to FIFA 23 or football games not made by EA. I would say wait until EA fix this mess but I really don't think they have any plans to. Very sad to see such a large gaming company release such an unfinished game.
