Where do I start here? I have been playing fifa games on and off for many years.
This game has quite some things to offer that would make it a good game. However, there are way too many flaws that hinder this from being a good game. At the end of the day, gamplay is the most important aspect (or should be...!) - but it seems EA is more concentrating on flooding the community with outside gameplay content, instead of working on the core issues of this game.
No. 1 and the most important for all plattforms:
Inconsistend gameplay - games where players turning luck trucks, take extra unnecessary touches, despite passing / shooting / skill move / direction change has been triggered for ages. This may all come down to lag compensation for me, as I have a stable good internet connection with about 20 ms latency to ea servers. But whatever the cause of this may be, this makes this game not enjoyable, even frustrating at times. If it is lag compensation, even worse, as this would mean people with good internet connections get punished (and put at a disadvantage) for the sake of people with lousy connections.
No 2. especially for PC users:
Awefully optimized for PC!! Same problems that constisted already in previous versions persist. Obviously EA is not interested in spending any resources into making this game decently playable on pc. I am running on a 7600X with a 6950 XT GPU and yet my graphics card is taken to to limit when just entering the menu. If you have set up 120ish fps or higher, the game runs at the same fps in the menus, let alone you unlimited the fps, which bring the FPS to 400 / 500 fps in the menus with 100% GPU utilization. Thing is, the menus are even harsher on the gpu as the actual gameplay is, which is beyond ridiculous. Then there is the mouse bug that hasn't been fixed from previous alterations, where you cant click buttons in the menu, as your mouse reappears in the middle of the screen occasionally.
No 3.: obviously blatant pay to win mechanics, nothing new here. This is only half way to blame on EA, the other half goes out to people spending money for digital content on this game. This is naturally everyone's decision, however to me this is beyond insanity.
No 4.: Bugs & Missing convenience
Just a few examples of what I mean by that:
- When you have duplicates, you can't buy players on the market via the smartphone app, ingame on the pc that is no problem.
- Simply missing obvious helpful options, such as limit player search to a certain ratio rating (e.g. 75 - 80) or
a function to select all you duplicates for a SBC, other than remembering each and everyone of them and searching and selecting them one by one. I can't understand why such easy functions are not in the game.
- Various crashes when tapping out of the game
- Game sometimes just freezes and crashes on the transfer market

This is written by a casual player, winning some games and losing some. For me it is not about just about winning and losing, but the experience in the process.

Hope this helps some people out making a decision on whether or not they should buy this game (let alone invest money for digital content).

Cheers

Edit: Completely forgot to mention the stutter occuring when the game switches from ingame to cutscences, whether you have set the cutscences to half frame rate or full frame rate. No matter which settings I choose in the game or in the graphic cards driver, this problem persisted.
Average EA games. Few bugs and very unoptimized settings. rather see paint dry than this.

I've had a couple of hours of this brown gem of the gaming industry...

Issues experienced in ONLY 6 hours of playtime, which makes me stop playing it:

7 CRASHES:
- 4 crashes of the anti-cheat with "117" error code in the middle of a Rivals match, assuming that I am suspiciously cheating when I never dare to cheat, as I've spent a lot of money, probably over ¬£1000.- on my games and skins on Steam and EA both.
- 3 random crashes without any sign or error code; the game just simply disappeared into the fog.

RANDOM CONTROLLER DISCONNECTS (HAPPENED 3 TIMES):
- While I was able to use my controllers Xbox button (the big X with the light) and inputs worked outside of the game, the game showed me a message that said my input device is disconnected and I had to restart the game to make it work properly again.

GAME IS STUCK:
- Once I was in the menu, the game did not respond to any of my input except the one that opens my friend list, the right trigger.
So, I was not able to navigate in the menu, neither with my keyboard, so I had to ALT+F4.
Sometimes, the game also stuck on start-up; FC24 image comes out, but the game would not launch at all.

STORE NOT WORKING:
- I also experienced some problems in the store.
I am not sure if it is a network issue-related problem or if it was a local issue, but I was unable to order any packs until I restarted the game.

PERFORMANCE ISSUES:
- I am playing on a high-end PC (Ryzen 9 3900X, RX 7900 XTX, 48 GB RAM, bunch of m2 SSDs), and I had a lot of FPS issues and stuck/stuttering, especially when I had the cinematic after a goal, missed chance, or the referee giving a card cinematic.

I have a couple of hundred hours in FIFA/FC or whatever it is called, but what I can see now is that this game is going down a slide and getting worse and worse every year and draining funds from the players, but don't misunderstand me, I also bought the game AGAIN, even after a decision when I said I will not buy it again, so there is no lazy/get used to it company without a horde of sheep to burn their money.
My personal peak was the 21, and the 22 was alright of the latest EA football games, but it was also very annoying sometimes with the bugs and the overpowered players like Fekir, Ben Yeder, etc. However, 2007 was the one I was really in love with.

This one, the 24, has a lot of issues and these issues are the same from year to year.
I believe that most players would be happy if these problems were finally fixed, and we could play with a smooth and issue-less game. 
Maybe try to do less, but better.

I know I did not even talk about my personal experience, which was alright.
The game, on its own, is fine-ish.
Players are extremely slow in my scenario and I cannot enjoy the defending, which is barely possible most of the time as the players are running everywhere and when they have to act with a slide or step in or anything, it is really hard to control them in the right way.
The game flows well, by the way; overall mood is okay; sometimes it feels like you are playing football.

Personal best thing during game-play:
Hyper-motion stuff, nice analytics and visual invention give a lot to the game.
I like the half-time animations with those walk-in to the changing room and warm-up animations.

Personal worst thing during game-play:
Power shot Zoom in makes defence even harder.

I would recommend buying this game because I want a better FIFA/FC again, and I know it requires a lot of funds, even more than what we've paid already with the packs and for the games. But I would not recommend buying this game because I feel like I am being robbed every year, paying for the same game again and again, and the ears of the developers and/or publisher do not hear our words. I will definitely not buy this game again, rather try my friends or simply watch a stream of it and make sure my issues are resolved before buying. I do not own the 23 for the same reason, but I had to give a chance to the 24, but I've already regretted it.

ear after year, EA, despite being one of the highest grossing video game company of all-time, you fail to actually deliver a product on release day that is reflective of its price. People are paying a premium for your games every year, and are met with some of the most lacklustre, mundane and boring features every year. Sure, you can blame us for continuing to buy the game, but the truth is, I love football. You love football. And FIFA/EA Sports FC is the only game out there that can scratch that itch. There are no viable competitors. Therefore, through our love for the beautiful game that is football, we keep buying it. And you know that, EA. That is why you refuse to actually do some hard coding in your game and add new features/improve the game.

It has become an unoptimized, unthought-out, slapped-together thing. The developers have gone for visuals, and because of that, they've made virtually every other parameter of the game 0. Since the destruction of the proper PES series, they have only released FIFA games that are glaringly flawed because they have no real competitior. In return they are very expensive and not a good game to say the least. Even though my computer meets the maximum requirements, it's still choppy, chunky and... just not good to play. It's sad that the same studio that made FIFA 07, FIFA 14, etc. has sunk to this level. 2/10

Trash, toxic, will ruin your day, week, month and the year.
Manager mode has no changes apart from a few cutscenes, the core mechanics are still the 90% same from 2015. 
Online play is a big d1ck competition of who can exploit the most glitches. Leaving the toxic community alone and the trash glitchy gameplay, EA has decided to implement lag compensation in online play, which will punishes you no matter how good your internet connection is, making already abysmal defence near impossible, resulting every match being a goal fest 'cause no one can defend. Ultimate team is gambling sim with EA rigging the pack weight shamelessly. The gameplay against AI isnt any better, the difficulty gap between World class and Legendary is absolutely massive. You can 10-0 world class but then get 10-0 by Legendary, nothing in between. So either play every game know you can score at will, making it boring or play against an AI which essentially bends the rules to score (60 rated will defend dribble and shoot like they're 90). Even the games you will win would not fulling 'cause you can feel the AI being mild for that particular game (it will still be 70-30 possession, have fun). So offline play is a coin toss between boring or incredibly unfair and frustrating. Online play is structured around a unfair gambling model, populated with toxic community on the back of terrible gameplay. 
It is shame that this is biggest product on the market for the lovers of the beautiful game. Football fans deserve better. FIFA was a big part of my childhood growing up but, now it is time to let it go. It isn't worth it to put up with what all this game will make you go thought. EA is never gonna fix it.

So I've waited a fair time to review this product, let me start off by saying that I have enjoyed FIFA for many years, with my first title being FIFA 13. 

I'd not recommend this game to anyone on PC. The reasoning behind this due to the below issues:

- Cursor glitch: physical cursor displays on screen when using a controller. You can disconnect your mouse and it'll still appear on the screen, even  mid game play.

- Poor servers: The servers for AU players are horrendous. I am running a wired connecting from my router to PC and the game states I have 24ms ping at all times. However, this is not the case... I have used a tool on EA's own website to test my connection to the servers and the result came back at over 300ms ping. 

- Game play is one dimensional: Meta has truly ruined this game. You simply cannot enjoy the game by using non-meta players. For instance, in FIFA 13/14, you could use a silver Brazilian team and be genuinely competitive against a fairly stacked team... this is what made the game fun.

- Input delay: The game on PC experiences a heavy input delay, whether the gameplay is good or bad. I do not believe a user should have to search far and wide to find the best settings in a game to experience the game at it's full capacity. Consumers pay for a finished product, not a product that is not optimised for a PC gaming experience.

Furthermore, not to mention the scripted moments within the game. In Ultimate Team, there's dynamic difficulty adjustment, which ensures your players are performing worse than their base states would suggest. There's no need for this in a Football simulator. Not only does it frustrate all players at all levels, it also disrupts the integrity of the game (not that there is much to begin with). 

There are moments when I do enjoy the game, however, these are all enjoyed with playing against my mates.

Please avoid this game.

There should be a new saying for all gamer alike, buy any games you want, but DON'T buy any from EA. I had to refund this through sheer annoyance and depression. FIFA games has been stagnant for years and years, and unfortunately it continues this trend with a terribly-done repackage game called EA SPORTS. It fails to optimise the game for PC gamers like us. And the game-play still feels the same from the previous entry to this franchise. It hasn't improved in any aspects, with only just minor new features that doesn't contribute to any significant importance to this games overall quality and enjoyment for hard-core gamers and causal gamers. I only had 1 hour play-through for this entire game, and yet it fails to live up to its expectations that this new refurbished game will contribute something different from the rest of its previous entries. 

3/10 - This is not a recommendable football game for any football fans and gamers alikes. ¬£60 is not worth for the quality of this game that has presented to us.

I have been playing FIFA for 15 years and when I tell you I want to enjoy this game, I mean it. Ruined the entire spirit of the game with this release. AI defenders are coded to fail you and allow numerous chances on goal. You are responsible for moving each toe on all 10 outfielders and even your best efforts will see the ball go straight through your players body. The only way to enjoy this game is controlling one avatar (i.e. Volta or Pro Clubs) and even there you cannot escape the culpable goalkeeping that will leave you flabbergasted. They literally put a win/loss ratio mid game in career mode which is hilarious that they are acknowledging when they are tuning up/down the acclimated difficulty settings offline.

TLDR: The people making this game now are not the game people who had a love of the game a decade ago. Its catered to worse, lesser skilled players while allowing their AI dictate who wins and loses. Don't waste your money unless you like the arcade style nature of the EA FC titles.

It is FIFA. that sentence alone should give you a level of expectation if you've played any previous iterations of this game. however, if it was the usual level of bad I wouldn't write this.

I've played FIFA since 2010 and ultimate team since 2013 and I can confidently say that this is the worst FIFA I have ever played. The worst game I've ever played possibly.

the gameplay has never been slower with the pay-to-win factor cranked up to 11. Goalkeepers may as well be replaced with cardboard cutouts of themselves for all the good they do. finishing that can make you hesitant to shoot inside the box, but bury every other finesse shot after passing from the corner. etc... 

the netcode is horrible and archaic which causes variable levels of sluggishness ranging from walking in pool water to walking in cement mix depending on which time of day you play.

the optimization for PC is laughable with launching the game taking ages, lagging in gameplay after cutscenes that compounds on the aforementioned problems, and the occasional cheaters.

Simply put, I would use this game to torture spies for information. If you are new, stay away. if you are a FIFA or football fan, skip this game or wait for an update.

Sadly addicted. Please take this as a warning and a strong recommendation to not get this game. This has more issues than the user interface just outright breaking from time to time or the game deciding your controller isn't plugged in despite being able to use it in the interface and now it's time to use your KB+M in games all of a sudden. I suppose it is marginally better than the game constantly blue screening like last year. There's a lot of weird in this game, and that's before we've got to the show that is an actual match.

This game doesn't feel like football. Your defenders have a knack of just switching off and not defending. Your attackers regularly don't use their apparent stats and start running when you have opportunities to break out and just idly trot instead. Playing online and offline is a joke in and of itself. People in the community say this is just skill issues. But then again anybody who isn't using 'skill issue' ironically is not to be listened to anyway.

Shooting is all dice rolls, the game turns into a quagmire whenever anybody applies any pressure tactics. Playing online can feel okay one moment and then absolutely dreadful the next. It's like there's something trying to constantly tell you your team of icons suck and you need better players. Buy the packs. Buy the points. Roll on the pack weight that's been neutered by adding a whole bunch of other stuff and constant new promos every week of new cards. Buy it all like you want to.

Close your wallet to this and to Electronic Arts.  I will be free next year. I promise.

EDIT: To add on the game issue and crashes I get I forgot to mention. The first being DirectX errors of "GetDeviceRemovedReason" is bizarre as I don't have Direct X failures in any of the other games I use. And they're a lot more demanding.

There's also an issue when I go to stream on Discord or to capture some of the dumbest stuff I've seen in the game where it won't capture and the screen goes invisible. Sort it out lads.

Red lentil, chickpea & chilli soup

if you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding Red lentil, chickpea & chilli soup recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients

2 tsp cumin seeds
large pinch chilli flakes
1 tbsp olive oil
1 red onion, chopped
140g red split lentils
850ml vegetable stock or water
400g can tomatoes, whole or chopped
4 tbsp 0% Greek yogurt, to serve

200g can chickpeas or ¬Ω a can, drained and rinsed (freeze leftovers)

small bunch coriander, roughly chopped (save a few leaves, to serve)

Directions

STEP 1
Heat a large saucepan and dry-fry 2 tsp cumin seeds and a large pinch of chilli flakes for 1 min, or until they start to jump around the pan and release their aromas.

STEP 2
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 chopped red onion, and cook for 5 mins.

STEP 3
Stir in 140g red split lentils, 850ml vegetable stock or water and a 400g can tomatoes, then bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 mins until the lentils have softened.

STEP 4
Whizz the soup with a stick blender or in a food processor until it is a rough pur√©e, pour back into the pan and add a 200g can drained and rinsed chickpeas.

STEP 5
Heat gently, season well and stir in a small bunch of chopped coriander, reserving a few leaves to serve. Finish with 4 tbsp 0% Greek yogurt and extra coriander leaves.

I've been an avid fan of the FIFA series for years, eagerly anticipating each new release with the hope of an improved gaming experience. However, EA FC 2024 has left me utterly disappointed and questioning the direction in which the franchise is heading. Strap yourselves in for a scathing review because this game is an absolute dumpster fire.

Let's kick things off with the most glaring issue - frame drops. Yes, you heard it right. In 2024, with cutting-edge hardware at my disposal, I still find myself encountering infuriating frame drops during crucial moments, such as corners and goal celebrations. It's almost as if the game is punishing me for successfully earning a set-piece or scoring a brilliant goal. These frame drops not only ruin the immersive experience but also affect gameplay, making it impossible to time your actions correctly. Imagine trying to defend a corner or relish a well-deserved goal only to be thwarted by a sudden lag spike ‚Äì it's beyond frustrating.

But that's not all. The game mechanics feel clunkier than ever before. Player movements are sluggish, ball physics are wonky, and the once-fluid gameplay has been replaced by an awkward and disjointed mess. It's like controlling a group of players who have never seen a soccer ball in their lives. EA FC 2024 takes a step backward in terms of playability, leaving me yearning for the smooth, responsive controls of its predecessors.

The graphics, touted as a selling point, are nothing more than a facade. Sure, the players might look more realistic, but what's the point when the overall presentation is marred by graphical glitches and awkward animations? I've witnessed players contorting into unnatural positions, goalkeepers performing acrobatics that defy the laws of physics, and ball trajectories that defy logic. It's as if the developers prioritized realism in appearance over actual gameplay quality.

In conclusion, EA FC 2024 is a disappointment of epic proportions. It's a regression from previous installments, plagued by frame drops, clunky gameplay, and an overwhelming emphasis on microtransactions. If you're a true fan of the FIFA series, do yourself a favor and stick to the earlier, more enjoyable editions. EA, it's time to step up your game or risk alienating the very community that has supported you for so long.

The game outside of UT is perfectly fine, besides the changes made to the training grounds.
Ultimate Team is now even more P2W than it has been any other year. From the very start the big big packs that we wouldn't see till Toty are out in week 1. The meta from Fifa23 carried over making the first few weeks basically unplayable for those that just chill and play for fun. After that it changed to 71 depth, 424/442/4231/442(2)/4222, with pressure after possession lost. This still has not been changed even after 5 or so weeks. The new Evolutions are a great concept but have been poorly executed. Within the first batch of Evos they made 78 Ansu Fati into an 84/85 that was a very cheap replacement for Mbappe with better links. Since then the evolutions have been not so game breaking until this last one where you can make Llorente even better. The DDA still rules supreme and sways matches away from the actually good to cater towards those that are worse. In previous years it was noticeable but not all that drastic to where a game would be decided on who had DDA in their favor. Not in EAFC24 though. In 24 the DDA decides matches unless you can somehow just be that much better. The best players will feel so much worse when DDA kicks in. Mbappe will feel like 78 pace, VVD will feel like a bronze, Courtious would be better replaced with the 1 arm woman. DDA is that bad in UT.

Update from 12/5/23:
Evo's have slowed down on being meta and broken and now are just replacements for recently released cards. The meta has not changed since the first week. Well that isnt true, it has gotten a lot worse in terms of play meta or loose the game. 4231-442-424-4321-4213-433(4) are now the most used with the center of the pitch being either overly congested to the point the attacking side can not play through it. At the same time the wingers, forward, and fullbacks will press anyone on the line making it so the best you can do is pass around the back, long balls over the top, or switching the full field. 4231 is the most commonly used formation since you not only have 8/10 players in the middle but also the LCAM and RCAM will occasionally push out to pressure on the line, the 2 CDM basically act as 2 CB and are most commonly the only players most will use to defend besides an occasional fullback. DDA is worse than ever, even worse than when I first wrote this review. You can be winning 4-0 in the 75th minute and tie 4-4 or lose 4-5 or 4-6 because DDA kicked in. Finesse shot and + are broken and the thing most based their attackers off of.
Luckily with what I have read from the new patch notes for the Holiday Update, the congesting the middle will now not be a viable meta, and finesse shot and + will have its accuracy reduced.

Update From 12/26/23
This is very close to the last update I did on my review but with a new patch and tons more new promos it felt like a good time to post an update.
After the Holiday Patch EA said that they fixed the congested midfield, pressure on the touch line, Finesse Shot and Shot+, and 3 back LM/RM. Congested midfield is true, it isn't as bad as it was but Pros have figured out tactics to counter the patch and share it with the public. This luckily is still very open in the middle. Pressure on the touch line isn't as heavy unless against a 5 back or 424. Finesse shot and + do not seem like that took any hit by the recent patch, they are still broken and now players are seeing this and deciding to hit it from 30+ yards out. Power headers were hit too hard, now the accuracy is terrible to the point itd be better to just play a corner short. 3 backs are now almost completely useless and back to the way they used to be. So all in all EA did a good patch that has mostly made the game tolerable again and semi-playable. DDA still runs all games and decides who wins and looses before kick off. If EA were to actually read reviews and see this all I'd ask is to fix DDA in UT and don't make it a thing. It is holding good players hostage in lower divisions because it is making their players hard to play with and letting the opposition win. When in reality it shouldn't be there and players should be able to climb back up tho their real ranks so that the lower ranks are for the actually bad players.

EA SPORTS FC‚Ñ¢ 24 is an absolute trainwreck of a game, plagued by two major issues that make it nothing short of a complete waste of time and money.

First off, let's talk about the fact that the game cannot even start properly. It's astonishing how a game released by a major publisher like EA can have such fundamental issues. Time and time again, I've tried to launch the game, only to be met with endless loading screens, crashes, and game-breaking bugs. It's like EA didn't bother with any quality control whatsoever. It's infuriating to spend your hard-earned money on a product that can't even perform its most basic function ‚Äì starting the game!

But it doesn't end there. EA, true to their reputation, has also managed to mess up the microtransactions in the game. You'd think they would have perfected this aspect by now, but no. The inability to purchase Points, the in-game currency necessary for any sort of progress, is laughably frustrating. I've tried multiple times to give them even more of my money in exchange for Points, but the game just won't let me. It's as if they don't want my money or care about their paying customers.

In summary, EA SPORTS FC‚Ñ¢ 24 is a total disaster of a game. The fact that it can't even start reliably and the broken microtransactions are just the tip of the iceberg. This game is a prime example of everything that's wrong with the gaming industry ‚Äì releasing unfinished, broken products and then trying to squeeze every last dollar out of players. Save your money and your sanity and stay far away from this mess of a game. EA should be ashamed of themselves for releasing this travesty.

First of all my review is for the single player of the game as this is all i play but some points may pass over to multiplayer. 

Its been months since it released yet there are so many bugs in it you might as well consider this game early access. I had players play all games in the season and they submit a transfer request for not playing enough. I had a player ask me to take him off for the next game because he was tired (He was) and when i did just that he got angry and wanted to be transferred. The board objectives make no sense sometimes like they want me to raise the average age of the team but also sign young players. Also there are numerous graphical glitches and they show in every game like clipping and pixelated parts of the textures while the rest of them are fine. 

Most of the time i don't feel like i am controlling the players. I can literally feel fighting with the player i am controlling to force him to do what i need. They added thousands of new animations but i feel like now i am getting stuck in an animation for every movement i do causing lots of issues. 
Defending is horrid. All matches i play live end with outlandish scores like 5-6 or 8-6. Every time i concede a goal it feels like i am conceding the same 3 or 4 goals. I also score a lot of goals but they are the same over and over. The game no longer allows variation just grab a fast winger and score. Hat tricks all over the place and no matter what defender i use its the same. The rival team players become like gods at times making it impossible to defend them like powering through tackles and not being fazed and getting insane speed bonuses with the ball and off the ball. I had cases where a player would just get tackled multiple times without loosing the ball at all. I can hear my tackle making contact but he just clips through. Even when i score it feels like i am cheesing the game. Scoring goals is fun but when you score so much they loose their value.
same game as the past 20 years, so  if you like me and buy every 5 or 6 years for the graphics is a good game, if you have a 20 ish fc/fifa, dont waste your money
